src.url: images\1000W Stereo Audio Amplifier with Transistors 2SC5200 and 2SA1943.jpg

description.about: A high-power stereo audio amplifier designed for robust sound output, capable of driving large subwoofers and multi-channel systems.
description.coding: No microcontroller or digital logic used; pure analog amplification.
description.hardware: Transistors 2SC5200 and 2SA1943, large heat sinks, toroidal transformer, filter capacitors, and audio jacks.
description.additional: Used in home theater setup, manually tuned biasing and gain stage, high-efficiency cooling system.

src.url: images\3D-Printet Frosted Lamp + WS2812B Digital LED + Controlled From ESP8266 + WIFI Control Pannel + Patterns + Alexa Support + Sinric Pro Connectivity.gif

description.about: A 3D-printed frosted lamp with customizable RGB animations, Wi-Fi control, and Alexa voice integration. Designed for ambient lighting and automation.
description.coding: Arduino code on ESP8266 using FastLED and Sinric Pro libraries. Handles OTA updates, color selection, brightness, and pattern animations.
description.hardware: ESP8266 NodeMCU, WS2812B LED strip, custom 3D-printed diffuser, USB power, and push buttons for manual control.
description.additional: Controlled via web panel and Alexa. Supports effects like rainbow, wave, breathing, and static colors with smooth transitions.

description.about: Custom-built 7.1 surround sound audio system featuring powerful subwoofer, speaker arrays, and a self-designed controller MPU. Designed for home theater with immersive sound experience.
description.coding: Developed firmware for Atmega8 microcontroller to manage input selection, volume control via rotary encoder, and display data on a 16x2 LCD. Handles channel routing and switching logic.
description.hardware: Pioneer TS-W1212D4 Subwoofer, Sony XS-FB162E Speakers, Sony XM-N1004 Amplifiers, Atmega8 MCU, 16x2 LCD, Rotary Encoder, custom-fabricated PCB, reused CPU cabinet for main unit, hand-built enclosures for subwoofer and speakers.
description.additional: Designed and wired complete amplifier unit, subwoofer tuning, speaker phase balancing, and control panel integration. The MPU video showcases the interactive setup of the control unit.

src.url: images\Alexa Voice Controlle Gaming Table Light.mp4

description.about: RGB lighting setup integrated beneath the gaming table, controlled via voice commands using Alexa for enhanced gaming ambiance.
description.coding: Firmware on ESP8266 using Arduino core; connected with Alexa through Sinric Pro and custom Alexa skills to toggle colors, patterns, and brightness.
description.hardware: ESP8266 microcontroller, 5050 RGB LED strip, 12V power supply, MOSFET driver for LEDs, Wi-Fi setup for Alexa integration.
description.additional: Voice commands enable pattern change, color setting, and power on/off without manual interaction, enhancing desk aesthetics during PC gaming sessions.

description.about: An automatic irrigation system for agricultural fields.
description.coding: Microcontroller logic to read moisture and control valves.
description.hardware: Moisture Sensor, Atmega8, Relay, Solenoid Valve, LEDs.
description.additional: Controls water flow based on soil moisture levels. Used in college project.

description.about: Multi-functional development board for embedded experiments.
description.coding: Includes relay, TRIAC, keypad, segment display and LED matrix control.
description.hardware: Atmega8, LED Matrix, 4x4 Keypad, Relay, TRIAC, MOC, 16x2 LCD, 7 Segment Display.
description.additional: Custom fabricated PCB using iron transfer and FeCl3 etching.

description.about: Smart RGB LED Lamps with Alexa Control.
description.coding: HTML-based control panel hosted on ESP8266 with SinricPro integration.
description.hardware: ESP8266, WS2812B, 3D-Printed Lampshade.
description.additional: WiFi control + voice commands + local UI panel.

description.about: Laser beam based intruder detection system.
description.coding: 555 timer to delay relay triggering.
description.hardware: Laser, LDR, Relay, 555 Timer.
description.additional: Activates light when laser beam is broken. Delays off for 15 seconds.

description.about: 3D LED Cube to display animations.
description.coding: Custom coded animations with AVR MCU.
description.hardware: Atmega8, 125 Blue LEDs (5x5x5).
description.additional: Creates 3D lighting effects.

description.about: College-era project where I began exploring LED matrix layouts and 2-layer PCB design. This image shows a 3D render of the PCB generated using DipTrace.
description.coding: No coding involved at this stage – focus was on circuit design and layout.
description.hardware: Designed for 8x8 LED matrix driving, intended to be powered by MCU like Atmega8 or Arduino in future builds.
description.additional: This project marked my early exploration into PCB CAD tools, particularly DipTrace, learning about component placement, via routing, and 3D visualization.

description.about: Initial experiment with WS2812B LEDs to understand how data pulses and cycles trigger RGB values. This project demonstrates a moving eye animation on an 8x8 LED matrix.
description.coding: C/C++ with Arduino – Custom bit patterns written to drive color transitions and animations across the 64-LED matrix.
description.hardware: 8x8 WS2812B LED matrix, Arduino UNO/Nano for signal generation, 5V power supply.
description.additional: This was part of my foundational learning on how LED strip timing works, how GRB bits are parsed per LED, and how visual animations are constructed frame by frame.

title: Pixel Table with VIA Motherboard Control

description.about: A creative lighting setup where a WS2812B LED strip is mounted under a wooden table, with light passing through drilled holes to create pixel-like lighting effects on the surface.
description.coding: Controlled via custom software from a VIA motherboard’s internal USB or serial port, driving LED data through a microcontroller interface.
description.hardware: WS2812B LED strip, table with drilled holes for light diffusion, old VIA motherboard, Arduino/ESP interface for LED control.
description.additional: Designed for visual aesthetics and mood lighting. Patterns include wave, sparkle, and spectrum animations triggered via PC interface.

description.about: Set of small form-factor portable speaker systems.
description.coding: Bluetooth input routing with amplifier circuit.
description.hardware: PAM8403, TP4056, 2.5" and 3" Speakers, Li-ion Battery.
description.additional: Rechargeable compact designs with 3.5mm input.

description.about: College project to build quadcopter with custom PCBs.
description.coding: Motor control with embedded code.
description.hardware: BLDC Motors, Custom PCB.
description.additional: Basic stability and rotation tests.

description.about: WiFi controlled RC car using phone sensors.
description.coding: Phone accelerometer input mapped to servo/motor control via ESP.
description.hardware: Atmega8, ULN2003, ESP8266, Servo, Li-ion Battery.
description.additional: Direction and speed controlled remotely via mobile.

description.about: Custom-built RF-based remote control system to wirelessly operate home appliances, similar to a TV remote. Developed as a self-learning project during college vacations.
description.coding: Basic Embedded C programming on Atmega8 for decoding RF signals and triggering relays based on received commands.
description.hardware: 433 MHz RF transmitter and receiver modules, Atmega8 microcontroller, relays, light control board, 12V supply, custom PCB.
description.additional: Receiver embedded inside switchboard housing, capable of switching appliances like lights and fans remotely using the RF transmitter unit.

description.about: Converted a regular mood lamp into a smart RGB lamp for aesthetic home decor. The lamp is controllable via Alexa voice commands.
description.coding: ESP8266 programmed using Arduino framework to receive Alexa commands via Sinric Pro and control the RGB LED.
description.hardware: ESP8266 NodeMCU, RGB LED (common cathode), power supply, modified lamp housing.
description.additional: Lamp connected to Wi-Fi network, responds to Alexa commands like 'Turn on lamp', 'Set color to blue', etc. Enhances home ambience with programmable lighting.

description.about: Touchless water tap using IR sensors.
description.coding: Flow detection and solenoid valve control.
description.hardware: IR Sensor, Atmega8, Solenoid Valve.
description.additional: Auto on/off tap for water conservation.

description.about: Project to control a 4-motor RC car over a Wi-Fi TCP/IP connection between two ESP8266 modules, simulating remote vehicle control.
description.coding: Arduino code for ESP8266 using `WiFiServer` and `WiFiClient` classes to establish socket communication. Pushbutton commands simulated in Proteus sent over network to second ESP controlling motors.
description.hardware: 2× ESP8266 NodeMCU modules, USB-to-Serial CH340 module for programming/config (via AT commands and Arduino), ULN2003 driver IC, 4× DC motors, power supply unit, pushbuttons, and simulation via Proteus.
description.additional: Project helped understand networking basics with ESP8266, COM port configuration, and motor control logic remotely triggered via socket messages.

description.about: Smart AC socket with timer-based on/off functionality.
description.coding: Time set via buttons and controlled by microcontroller.
description.hardware: Atmega8, 7-Segment Display, Relays.
description.additional: Programmable plug socket for consumer usage.

description.about: USB switch to share mouse/keyboard/headset between two PCs.
description.coding: Push button toggles active USB host.
description.hardware: Atmega8, Relays, USB Ports.
description.additional: Physical USB switching across computers.
